metadata.title: 5 Things To Know: July 9, 2025
metadata.description: CNBC's Melissa Lee reports on the 5 things to know ahead of Tuesday's trading day.

transcript.full_text: All right, we do have five things to know ahead of today's opening bell. SpaceX is discussing plans to raise money and sell insider shares in a deal that would value the company at around $400 billion. The Financial Times reported that the deal was sent to investors yesterday. Sources tell CNBC that Starbucks China unit has attracted offers for a potential stake sale, valuing the China business at up to $10 billion. Potential bidders include the Carlyle Group, KKR, and Centurium Capital, which owns a majority stake in China's Luckin Coffee. Boeing reported deliveries of 60 airplanes last month, the most since December of 2023, that brings the company's second quarter delivery total to 150 airplanes. Uh, the company is such report full second quarter results on July 29th. The TSA confirming yesterday that it will let many travelers leave their shoes on at US Airport check points. Homeland Security Secretary Christie Noam announced the end of the 20-year-old rule at a news conference, citing advances in screening technology. And Philadelphia's largest municipal union reached a tentative deal with the city early this morning to end a labor strike that has halted garbage collection since July 1st. Ugh. Uh, Philadelphia's mayor said the new deal is for three years. It is believed to include 9% in raises spread out over three years.

analysis.summary:
The transcript provides an overview of five significant news items concerning business and public policy. SpaceX is reportedly engaged in discussions to secure new funding and facilitate the sale of insider shares, a move that could elevate the company's valuation to approximately $400 billion. This financial initiative, as reported by the Financial Times, was presented to investors yesterday.

In the realm of corporate divestitures, Starbucks' China division is drawing considerable interest, having received offers for a potential stake sale that could value the business at up to $10 billion. Key entities exploring this opportunity include the Carlyle Group, KKR, and Centurium Capital, with the latter already a majority shareholder in China's Luckin Coffee.

Meanwhile, in the aviation industry, Boeing announced its latest delivery figures, with 60 airplanes delivered last month, marking its highest monthly total since December 2023. This brings the company's total second-quarter deliveries to 150 airplanes, ahead of its full second-quarter results release scheduled for July 29th. Concurrently, a notable change in travel security policy was confirmed yesterday by the Transportation Security Administration (TSA), which will now permit many travelers to keep their shoes on at U.S. airport checkpoints. Homeland Security Secretary Christie Noam attributed the cessation of the two-decade-old rule to advancements in screening technology.

Finally, the city of Philadelphia and its largest municipal union have reached a tentative agreement early this morning, aimed at concluding a labor strike that has disrupted garbage collection since July 1st. Philadelphia's mayor indicated that the new deal spans three years and is expected to include a 9% wage increase, distributed over the three-year term of the agreement.

key_points.text: An overview of five key news items is provided before today's opening bell.
SpaceX is currently in discussions to raise capital.
SpaceX plans include selling insider shares.
The proposed deal would value SpaceX at approximately $400 billion.
The Financial Times reported on the SpaceX deal.
The SpaceX deal was reportedly sent to investors yesterday.
Starbucks China's unit has received offers for a potential stake sale.
The stake sale could value Starbucks China's business at up to $10 billion.
CNBC sources indicate the offers for Starbucks China.
The Carlyle Group is a potential bidder for a stake in Starbucks China.
KKR is also identified as a potential bidder for Starbucks China.
Centurium Capital is among the potential bidders for Starbucks China.
Centurium Capital owns a majority stake in Luckin Coffee.
Boeing reported delivering 60 airplanes last month.
This marks Boeing's highest monthly delivery total since December 2023.
Boeing's second-quarter delivery total has reached 150 airplanes.
Boeing plans to report its full second-quarter results on July 29th.
The TSA confirmed a policy change yesterday regarding footwear at airport checkpoints.
Many travelers will now be permitted to keep their shoes on at US Airport checkpoints.
Homeland Security Secretary Christie Noam announced the new TSA policy.
The policy change ends a 20-year-old rule.
Advances in screening technology were cited as the reason for the rule change.
Philadelphia's largest municipal union reached a tentative deal with the city.
The deal, reached early this morning, aims to end a labor strike.
The strike had caused a halt in garbage collection in Philadelphia.
Garbage collection has been halted since July 1st.
Philadelphia's mayor confirmed the new deal is set for three years.
The deal is expected to include a 9% raise for union members.
The 9% raises are scheduled to be spread out over the three-year deal period.

timeline_events.event_description: Financial Times reported that SpaceX's deal was sent to investors.
Boeing reported 60 airplane deliveries, the most since December 2023.
Boeing is scheduled to report full second-quarter results.
TSA confirmed that many travelers can leave their shoes on at US Airport checkpoints.
Homeland Security Secretary Christie Noam announced the end of the 20-year-old shoe rule.
Philadelphia's largest municipal union reached a tentative deal with the city to end a labor strike.
Labor strike halted garbage collection in Philadelphia.

temporal_patterns.description: SpaceX is progressing through a financial process to raise money and sell insider shares, with reports indicating a deal was sent to investors recently.
temporal_patterns.significance: Indicates a significant ongoing financial development for SpaceX.

temporal_patterns.description: Boeing's airplane deliveries show an upward trend, with 60 deliveries last month being the most since December 2023, contributing to a total of 150 for the second quarter.
temporal_patterns.significance: Highlights an improvement in Boeing's production and delivery performance over time.
temporal_patterns.timespan: December 2023 to last month (June 2024), encompassing Q2

temporal_patterns.description: A 20-year-old TSA rule was ended, directly caused by advances in screening technology, demonstrating a long-term causality between technological progress and policy change.
temporal_patterns.significance: Illustrates how sustained technological improvement can lead to the discontinuation of long-standing regulations.
temporal_patterns.timespan: 20-year duration of the rule, with recent termination

temporal_patterns.description: The Philadelphia labor strike, which began on July 1st, was resolved early this morning with a new three-year deal that includes raises spread out over its duration.
temporal_patterns.significance: Marks the conclusion of a significant labor dispute and establishes a new multi-year agreement for city employees.
temporal_patterns.timespan: Strike from July 1st to early this morning; deal for three years
